programme.desc: Stories of wintertime survival include the park's toughest inhabitants; a bobcat hunts for waterfowl; otters find fishing holes; bison migrate to Yellowstone's geothermal core; a look at the park's geysers and hot springs through thermal imagery.

programme.title: In My Father's House
programme.desc: Rapper Che "Rhymefest" Smith reunites with his homeless father after 25 years.

programme.title: Head of State
programme.desc: A low-level Washington, D.C., public servant, Mays Gilliam (Chris Rock), is thrust into the national spotlight when he's asked by Martin Geller (Dylan Baker), the head of the Democratic Party, to run for president after the party's presidential and vice-presidential nominees are killed in a plane crash. The odds are against Gilliam, mostly because he has a penchant for telling the truth about what is wrong with the country. Remarkably, his straight-talking style catches on with the public.

programme.title: Last Holiday
programme.desc: The discovery that she has a terminal illness prompts introverted saleswoman Georgia Byrd (Queen Latifah) to reflect on what she realizes has been an overly cautious life. So Georgia withdraws her life savings and jets off to Europe where she lives like a millionaire. Upbeat and passionate, Georgia charms everybody she meets, including renowned Chef Didier (Gérard Depardieu). The only one missing from her new life is her longtime crush Sean Matthews (LL Cool J).

programme.title: Queenpins
programme.desc: A frustrated suburban housewife and her best friend hatch an illegal coupon-club scheme that scams millions from corporations and delivers deals to legions of fellow coupon clippers. Hot on their trail is an unlikely duo -- a hapless loss-prevention officer and a determined U.S. postal inspector -- both looking to end their criminal enterprise.

programme.title: Anaconda
programme.desc: Filmmaker Terri Flores (Jennifer Lopez) is traveling deep in the Amazon jungle looking for a forgotten tribe. Terri and her crew, which includes an anthropologist (Eric Stoltz) and a cameraman (Ice Cube), come across Paul (Jon Voight), who is stranded on the riverbank. He offers to help them find the tribe, but his secretive behavior puts everyone on edge. They realize too late that he's using them to find a legendary anaconda that's worth a fortune -- if they can catch it.

programme.title: The Best of All the Smoke With Matt Barnes and Stephen Jackson
programme.desc: Celtics Hall of Famer Paul Pierce shares untold stories, comparisons to Dwyane Wade, and winning a championship in Boston.

programme.title: Get Rich or Die Tryin'
programme.desc: After losing his mother to murder as a boy, Marcus (Curtis "50 Cent" Jackson) has little support in his life. He starts working for drug dealer Levar (Bill Duke) and his assistant (Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje). Although Marcus makes good money selling, his dream is to become a rapper. When he reunites with an old love (Joy Bryant) and is later shot numerous times during a robbery, Marcus decides it's time to change his life. However, his old associates won't let him go so easily.

programme.title: Crash
programme.desc: Writer-director Paul Haggis interweaves several connected stories about race, class, family and gender in Los Angeles in the aftermath of 9/11. Characters include a district attorney (Brendan Fraser) and his casually prejudiced wife (Sandra Bullock), dating police detectives Graham (Don Cheadle) and Ria (Jennifer Esposito), a victimized Middle Eastern store owner and a wealthy African-American couple (Terrence Dashon Howard, Thandie Newton) humiliated by a racist traffic cop (Matt Dillon).

programme.title: Fruitvale Station
programme.desc: Though he once spent time in San Quentin, 22-year-old black man Oscar Grant (Michael B. Jordan) is now trying hard to live a clean life and support his girlfriend (Melonie Diaz) and young daughter (Ariana Neal). Flashbacks reveal the last day in Oscar's life, in which he accompanied his family and friends to San Francisco to watch fireworks on New Year's Eve, and, on the way back home, became swept up in an altercation with police that ended in tragedy. Based on a true story.

programme.title: The Wash
programme.desc: "The Wash" is an action-comedy starring Snoop Dogg and Dr. Dre. As mismatched roommates working at a car wash, they come together to rescue their boss (George Wallace) from a couple of first-time kidnappers. If they don't settle their differences and get Mr. Washington back, the good times at "The Wash" will soon come to an end.

programme.title: Small City
programme.desc: When a drug mule becomes sick in transit, one of the men tasked with her collection is left shaken. The man soon discovers the girl is to be sold to traffickers, and the unlikely duo are then forced to flee a hostile city.

programme.title: Memphis
programme.desc: A singer with an angelic voice wanders around Memphis.

programme.title: Useless Humans
programme.desc: Four friends must save the world when a ruthless alien crashes a birthday party.

programme.title: The Honeymooners
programme.desc: Ralph Kramden (Cedric the Entertainer) drives a bus in New York City but dreams of something more. Unfortunately, none of Ralph's business ideas -- which often incorporate his best friend, Ed (Mike Epps) -- have panned out. Knowing their husbands will never get them out of the city, Ralph's wife, Alice (Gabrielle Union), and Ed's wife, Trixie (Regina Hall), pool their savings to purchase a house in the suburbs. But once the men find out about the secret stash, they might just blow it all.

programme.title: A Raisin in the Sun
programme.desc: Lena Younger (Phylicia Rashad) receives a settlement from her husband's life insurance policy and then must decide what to do with the money. She wants to move out of their apartment into a house in a more genteel neighborhood. Her eldest son, Walter (Sean Combs), aspires to be an entrepreneur. Daughter Beneatha (Sanaa Lathan) hopes to go to medical school. Though their aspirations collide, they try to find a way to retain their family's cohesion.

programme.title: Public Enemy
programme.desc: A fan gives stranded rappers Public Enemy a ride in his run-down car.

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: After his release from prison, Jake (John Belushi) reunites with his brother, Elwood (Dan Aykroyd) -- collectively known as the "Blues Brothers." Jake's first task is to save the orphanage the brothers grew up in from closing, by raising $5,000 to pay back taxes. The two are convinced they can earn the money by getting their old band back together. However, after playing several gigs and making a few enemies, including the police, the brothers face daunting odds to deliver the money on time.

programme.title: Blues Brothers 2000
programme.desc: The now-brotherless Ellwood Blues (Dan Aykroyd) is finally out of prison, attempting to reunite the old band and find a few new partners in crime (John Goodman), (J. Evan Bonifant). In this sequel to the original "Blues Brothers" comedy/musical, Ellwood battles the Chicago police, sings and dances his way out of numerous sticky situations, and manages to get the old band on the road for a hair-raising adventure.

programme.title: The Hurt Locker
programme.desc: Staff Sgt. William James (Jeremy Renner), Sgt. J.T. Sanborn (Anthony Mackie) and Specialist Owen Eldridge (Brian Geraghty) are members of a bomb-disposal unit in Baghdad. As their tour of duty enters its final weeks, the men face a set of increasingly hazardous situations, any of which could end their lives in an explosive instant.

programme.title: Déjà Vu
programme.desc: The team of top-secret program brings ATF agent Doug Carlin (Denzel Washington) into its midst to capture the terrorist (Jim Caviezel) responsible for a ferry bombing that left hundreds dead. Its amazing technology lets the team fold time four days backward and see the madman's movements as he plots to kill a woman who could give him away. Doug realizes that the technology could allow him to do what law-enforcement officers dream of -- go back in time to prevent the crime.

programme.title: Rolling Like Thunder
programme.desc: Stories of myth-like artists, remarkable romances and competitive battles reveal the risk behind freight train and graffiti culture (New!).

programme.title: Yellowjackets
programme.desc: Out in the wilderness, the girls ride the crimson wave and plan a dark arts slumber party; Natalie and Misty tame a stallion; on Halloween night, Shauna parties like it's 1996.

programme.title: Man on Fire
programme.desc: In a Mexico City wracked by a recent wave of kidnappings, ex-CIA operative John Creasy (Denzel Washington) reluctantly accepts a job as a bodyguard for 9-year-old Lupita (Dakota Fanning), the daughter of wealthy businessman Samuel Ramos (Marc Anthony). Just as Creasy begins to develop a fondness for the young girl, a bloodthirsty gunman (Jesús Ochoa) kidnaps her. Now, Creasy must pick off a succession of corrupt cops and criminals to reach his ultimate object of vengeance.

programme.title: Soul Plane
programme.desc: Following a ridiculously awful flight that leads to his pet's death, Nashawn Wade (Kevin Hart) files a lawsuit against the airline, and wins a multimillion-dollar settlement. Determined to create a better flying experience, Nashawn starts his own airline, one that caters to an African-American clientele. Going into business with a tricked-out plane piloted by the smooth Capt. Mack (Snoop "Doggy" Dogg), the airline hits a snag when it has to deal with the family of Elvis Hunkee (Tom Arnold).

programme.title: In Fabric
programme.desc: A lonely divorcee visits a bewitching London department store to find a dress to transform her life. She soon finds a perfect, artery-red gown that unleashes a malevolent, unstoppable curse.

programme.title: Desus & Mero
programme.desc: Actors Keanu Reeves and Carrie-Anne Moss ("The Matrix Resurrections").

programme.title: Reign Over Me
programme.desc: Charlie Fineman (Adam Sandler), who lost his family in the terrorist attacks of Sept. 11, still grieves over their deaths. He runs into his former college roommate, Alan Johnson (Don Cheadle), and the two rekindle their friendship. Alan himself is feeling the strain of family and professional responsibilities, and his renewed bond with Charlie gives both men the strength to carry on during a turning point in their lives.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Attempting to win the favor of the newly divorced Suzanne (Nia Long), Nick (Ice Cube) offers to accompany her children, Lindsey (Aleisha Allen) and Kevin (Philip Bolden), on a flight from Portland, Ore., to Canada to see their mother. A mishap with a corkscrew and a metal detector gets the troupe banned from the flight, however, so Nick is forced to drive the kids in his prized Lincoln Navigator. Tensions inevitably rise during the long road trip, but Nick is not to be deterred.

programme.title: Michael Jackson's This Is It
programme.desc: Prior to his untimely death, Jackson was in the midst of preparing for a series of sold-out concerts that were scheduled to take place in London during the summer of 2009. Behind-the-scenes footage, filmed between March and June of 2009, captures the pop superstar in intimate detail as he developed and rehearsed for the "This Is It" tour.

programme.title: Queen Collective 2020
programme.desc: Twelve-year-old composer Grace Moore navigates the challenges of today's world and writes a new composition, making a space for herself in classical music and sharing her gift.

programme.title: Gridiron Gang
programme.desc: A counselor (The Rock) at a juvenile detention facility decides to turn the young inmates in his charge into a football team to give them a sense of self-respect and social responsibility, but he faces opposition from high-school coaches who do not want their players facing criminals on the field.

programme.title: Crash
programme.desc: Writer-director Paul Haggis interweaves several connected stories about race, class, family and gender in Los Angeles in the aftermath of 9/11. Characters include a district attorney (Brendan Fraser) and his casually prejudiced wife (Sandra Bullock), dating police detectives Graham (Don Cheadle) and Ria (Jennifer Esposito), a victimized Middle Eastern store owner and a wealthy African-American couple (Terrence Dashon Howard, Thandie Newton) humiliated by a racist traffic cop (Matt Dillon).

programme.title: Rollerball
programme.desc: Jonathan (Chris Klein) is the most popular player in the fastest and most extreme sport of all time: rollerball. Along with teammates Marcus (LL Cool J) and Aurora (Rebecca Romijn-Stamos), Jonathan is giving viewers what they want: visceral thrills, breakneck speed, and head-slamming action. Things go wrong when rollerball's creator, Petrovich (Jean Reno), realizes that serious on-court accidents bring higher ratings. Soon Jonathan and his friends are playing for their lives.

programme.title: Gamer
programme.desc: Each week Kable (Gerard Butler), a death-row inmate, battles his fellow prisoners in a violent online game called "Slayers," his every move controlled by a young gamer's remote device. To the players, Kable and the other inmates are just simulated characters. But, to a resistance group that opposes the game's inventor, Kable is a critical component of their plan to end the inventor's form of high-tech slavery.

programme.title: Django Unchained
programme.desc: Two years before the Civil War, Django (Jamie Foxx), a slave, finds himself accompanying an unorthodox German bounty hunter named Dr. King Schultz (Christoph Waltz) on a mission to capture the vicious Brittle brothers. Their mission successful, Schultz frees Django, and together they hunt the South's most-wanted criminals. Their travels take them to the infamous plantation of shady Calvin Candie (Leonardo DiCaprio), where Django's long-lost wife (Kerry Washington) is still a slave.

programme.title: The Chronicles of Riddick
programme.desc: Galactic criminal Riddick (Vin Diesel) is on the run, with bounty hunters on his tail. He receives guidance from Aereon (Judi Dench), ambassador from the Elemental race, who informs him that a warrior army known as the Necromongers is annihilating all human life in the galaxy in a bid for universal dominance. The wise Aereon urges Riddick into battle, believing he is the one man who can defeat the Necromongers and their leader, the evil Lord Marshal (Colm Feore).

programme.title: Richard Pryor Live on the Sunset Strip
programme.desc: Richard Pryor takes the stage at the infamous Hollywood Palladium in one of his first performances after a well-publicized battle with drugs. Older, wiser and funnier than ever, the venerable comic tells outrageous jokes and a number of moving stories about his personal past -- including one about a life-changing trip to Africa. Pryor's trenchant social commentary touches on an array of subjects, from prison and mobsters to hospitals and cocaine.

programme.title: A Knight's Tale
programme.desc: Peasant-born William Thatcher (Heath Ledger) begins a quest to change his stars, win the heart of an exceedingly fair maiden (Shanynn Sossamon) and rock his medieval world. With the help of friends (Mark Addy, Paul Bettany, Alan Tudyk), he faces the ultimate test of medieval gallantry -- tournament jousting -- and tries to discover if he has the mettle to become a legend.

programme.title: The Patriot
programme.desc: Mel Gibson portrays Benjamin Martin, an unassuming man who is forced to join the American Revolution when the British threaten to take his farm away from him. Together with his patriotic son, Gabriel, the pair faces the vicious Redcoats with a heroism that reflects the stubborn pride of a young country's most dedicated supporters.

programme.title: Bad Boys
programme.desc: Miami-Dade detectives Mike Lowrey (Will Smith) and Marcus Burnett (Martin Lawrence) blow a fuse when $100 million worth of heroin they recently confiscated is heisted from station headquarters. Suspecting it was an inside job, Internal Affairs gives them five days to track down the drugs before they shut down the narcotics division. Action meets farce when Marcus is compelled to masquerade as his partner in order to gain the trust of a call girl (Tea Leoni), a key witness in their investigation.

programme.title: Bad Boys II
programme.desc: The drug ecstasy is flowing into Miami, and the police want it stopped. Police Detective Marcus Burnett (Martin Lawrence) and his partner, Mike Lowrey (Will Smith), are just the men to do it. They track the drugs to a Cuban smuggler, Johnny Tapia (Jordi Mollà), who is also involved in a bloody war with Russian and Haitian mobsters. If that isn't bad enough, there's tension between the two cops because Lowrey is romantically involved with Burnett's sister, Syd (Gabrielle Union).

programme.title: Weird Wonders
programme.desc: Find out why a much-loved dolphin has started breaking people's bones, and why a caterpillar wears a hat made out of its own spare heads.

programme.title: Weird Wonders
programme.desc: Discover the science behind the puzzle of strange balls of worms on a road, and how an Australian town became plagued by giant bats.

programme.title: Abraham Lincoln: Vampire Hunter
programme.desc: While still a boy, Abraham Lincoln loses his mother to a vampire's bite. He vows revenge, but fails in the attempt, narrowly escaping with his life. He is rescued by Henry (Dominic Cooper), a charismatic vampire hunter who instructs Abe in the fine art of dispatching bloodsuckers. Abe (Benjamin Walker) continues his fight against the undead well into adulthood and his presidency, making a last stand against the ultimate vampire foe (Rufus Sewell) on the eve of the Civil War's defining battle.

programme.title: The Taking of Pelham 123
programme.desc: Chaos reigns in the New York City subway system when heavily armed criminals, led by a mastermind named Ryder (John Travolta), hijack a subway train and threaten to kill everyone on board unless a large ransom is paid. Dispatcher Walter Garber (Denzel Washington) uses his extensive knowledge of the transit system in a bid to outwit the hijackers and save the hostages, but one question remains: even if the hijackers get their money, how can they possibly escape?

programme.title: Mad Max
programme.desc: In a not-too-distant dystopian future, when man's most precious resource -- oil -- has been depleted and the world plunged into war, famine and financial chaos, the last vestiges of the law in Australia attempt to restrain a vicious biker gang. Max (Mel Gibson), an officer with the Main Force Patrol, launches a personal vendetta against the gang when his wife (Joanne Samuel) and son are hunted down and murdered, leaving him with nothing but the instincts for survival and retribution.

programme.title: The Road Warrior
programme.desc: After avenging the death of his wife and young son at the hands of a vicious gang leader, Max (Mel Gibson) drives the post-apocalyptic highways of the Australian outback, fending off attacks from nomadic tribes that prey on outsiders. Falling into an encampment led by the relatively peaceful Pappagallo (Mike Preston), Max at first schemes to steal their oil, but soon becomes the group's reluctant defender against the hulking Humungus (Kjell Nilsson) and his ruthless marauders.

programme.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
programme.desc: Years after the collapse of civilization, the tyrannical Immortan Joe enslaves apocalypse survivors inside the desert fortress the Citadel. When the warrior Imperator Furiosa (Charlize Theron) leads the despot's five wives in a daring escape, she forges an alliance with Max Rockatansky (Tom Hardy), a loner and former captive. Fortified in the massive, armored truck the War Rig, they try to outrun the ruthless warlord and his henchmen in a deadly high-speed chase through the Wasteland.

programme.desc: Rachel visits Stockholm to learn tips from an award-winning chocolatier. Then she makes venison ragu and other dishes that are perfect for a celebration.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's 24 Hrs to Hell and Back
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay descends upon a Virginia based seafood restaurant situated right off a busy highway that isn't seeing much business these days. Seafarer's is run by two sisters, Amber and Autumn Halterman, who are always at war with each other.

programme.title: Jamie's Easy Meals for Every Day
programme.desc: Today Jamie shows us his quick and easy recipes for a French-style roast chicken dinner, his various uses for leftover bread, and he makes a delicious prawn linguine.

programme.title: Jamie's Easy Meals for Every Day
programme.desc: Today Jamie's quick and easy recipes include Margareta pizza meets roast chicken, and Prawn-toast toasties.

programme.title: Nigella's Cook, Eat, Repeat
programme.desc: Nigella indulges in a special Christmas edition with food from near and far, including Linzer cookies, pomegranate cocktails, smoked salmon on black bread and Norwegian pork ribs.

programme.title: Rachel's Coastal Cooking
programme.desc: Rachel visits Killary Fjord and helps farm mussels before finding an unusual farm by the sea in Rossaveal. She also goes to Connemara Smokehouse to prepare the perfect coastal picnic.

programme.title: Arabian Inferno
programme.desc: Each year a remote desert region undergoes an astonishing transformation into a lush oasis. Watch the arid landscape blossom into a frenzy of feeding and breeding for grazing camels, invertebrates, predatory birds, and the endemic Dhofar toad.

programme.title: The Great Elephant Tale
programme.desc: Follow the adventures of three elephants across three very distinct African habitats. Their travels combine to tell the story of how these emotional and intelligent creatures evolved over millions of years to survive on the continent.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: Crocodiles are formidable predators, superbly adapted with skull-crushing jaws and lightning speed. They were on Earth long before the dinosaurs, and have outlived them by millions of years. Now protected in Australia, their numbers have surged.

programme.title: Dogs With Extraordinary Jobs
programme.desc: Meet a golden retriever that assuages anxiety and helps heal PTSD, a shepherd mix who rescues mudslide survivors, a pair of spaniels who sniff out underground water leaks, and a group of teacher's pets in the UK that assist children learning to read.

programme.title: Dogs With Extraordinary Jobs
programme.desc: A blind woman has found a new lease on life thanks to her canine running mate, a Jack Russell works as a super-nanny to a surprising array of species, and a team of dogs in Kenya are on daily patrol protecting endangered rhinos from poachers.

programme.desc: Witness an explosive showdown between the all-female Hollywood pride and the Nomad brothers. Then check on Surabi, an MK female gored during a buffalo hunt, and Spotty, an MK cub whose fate hangs in the balance after he's separated from his pride.

programme.desc: In a beehive, tens of thousands of tiny animals work toward a common goal: the survival of the colony. But what is life like for an individual honeybee? A Bee's Diary tells that story.

programme.desc: Join the rescue as Amanda and Mandy try every trick in the book to help a snared hyena, a lion threatens a village, and the team's plan to release a troop of 13 monkeys is thwarted by last minute surgery and some crafty escape artists.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Grab a front row seat at one of the world's few accessible lava lakes. Travel with a group to the geologically-active Danakil Depression in Ethiopia and visit the summit of one of the world's most active volcanoes.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Italy's Mount Etna is one of the best places for volcano watchers. Join a team heading to Italy to capture a paroxysmal eruption which produces spectacular lava fountains that can shoot as high as a kilometre into the sky.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Animals that were once near extinction find refuge in the safety of zoos. Celebrate the birth of red pandas, twin snow leopard cubs, a southern white rhino, and a Sulawesi macaque, all species that are endangered in the wild.

programme.title: Surviving The Amazon
programme.desc: A jaguar stalks the riverbank. A venomous snake is on the move. A Colombian tarantula waits for night fall. Watch as these fierce predators prowl through the jungle and bite into their next great meal.

programme.title: Surviving The Amazon
programme.desc: It's not easy to fall in love in the jungle. Find out how these animals turn to strategic mating strategies in order to pass on their genes. Meet monkeys who like monogamy, a bird who rivals Casanova, and a spider who'll risk his life for love.

programme.title: Surviving The Amazon
programme.desc: How many trees can you find in the Amazon? And what's it like to live up in them? Travel through the canopy and see how more than 1200 species of trees coexist. Plus, follow monkeys and other creatures who call these trees home.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Spend a season with a group of thirty vervets, Africa's smallest monkeys. At the centre of the troop are two juveniles who must learn to feed themselves, distinguish friend from foe, and make their place in the world.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Some animals survive with a little help from their friends. Witness the ways buffalo, lions, hyenas, wild dogs, and even some birds work together to help each other protect their offspring, overcome predators, hunt, and defend their territory.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Safety is scarce in the Zambian wilderness, where predators hide in the shadows. With a bull hippo struck down in his prime, a young lion discovered in the bush, and a massive buffalo snuffed out in the mud, the chase is on to identify the culprit.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Visit animals in three extraordinary habitats: a baby giraffe takes its first steps in the sweltering Luangwa Valley, two thousand baboons have found a paradise in a Kasanka forest, and a cheetah family prowls for meat on the desolate Liuwa Plain.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: Researcher Andrea Marshall believes Mozambique-based manta rays may be attending the sardine run on South Africa's Wild Coast. The question is: why? Follow researchers as they track the creatures to understand their unusual migrating patterns.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: Mozambique's coastline is home to an array of marine life, but no species is safe from overfishing. Join the region's leading researchers on their journey to find and understand one of the ocean's most secretive creatures, before it's too late.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: The coast of Mozambique is home to giants, like humpbacks and whale sharks, but the tiniest species play just as big of a role in the ecosystem. Meet the scientists who are working against the clock to protect coastal creatures big and small.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: The ocean covers 70 percent of our planet and is home to as many as one million species, but it's a group of microscopic organisms known as plankton that make the biggest impact. Learn how these tiny drifters help sustain all life on earth.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: In the harsh animal kingdom, some lucky animal babies have a family ready to take care of them. Meet the protective clans of a koala joey, European elk twins, a litter of Asian short-clawed otters, and young Black howler monkeys.

programme.title: Reef Wrecks
programme.desc: Bonaire, a small island in the Southwest Caribbean, hosts one of the world's most vibrant reef ecosystems-and a collection of stunning shipwrecks. Meet the tarpon, eagle rays and tiny sea creatures that call these relics home.

programme.title: Reef Wrecks
programme.desc: The Florida Keys are home to as many as 1000 shipwrecks! They form what is known as "The Shipwreck Trail," a line-up of artificial reefs that provide the perfect shelter for fish-and a feeding ground for predators.

programme.title: Reef Wrecks
programme.desc: The Bahamas is known as the "underwater movie capital of the world". Hollywood has been coming here for decades, making epic movies and TV shows in its crystal clear waters, leaving behind a host of cinematic shipwrecks.

programme.title: Wild Pacific Rescue
programme.desc: Join the vet and his team in saving a massive sea lion caught in a plastic noose, and then visit the Rescue Centre, where a harbour seal pup may lose its eyesight and a baby sea otter needs a risky but life-saving surgery.

programme.title: Wild Pacific Rescue
programme.desc: Battle wind and waves to find a sea lion trapped in a plastic ring. Then visit the rescue centre, where over 80 orphan seals must be fed several times a day to prepare for release into the wild, and see an Amazonian duck get a miraculous operation.

programme.title: Wild Pacific Rescue
programme.desc: Follow the team in healing and releasing a grumpy sea turtle, and then meet a sea lion with an unusual injury that must be taken by crane to the rescue centre. Find out how the vet aids an aging fruit bat and a community rescues a one-eyed seal pup.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: The southwest corner of New Zealand's South Island is hemmed in by giant mountains and the rough Pacific Ocean. Rare penguins are locked in a daily game of cat and mouse with giant New Zealand sea lions. The sea lions also live in a tumultuous world, where pups must battle the elements to survive.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: In southwestern New Zealand, deep fiords and tidal lagoons are wrapped in green rainforest. The dark fjords harbour creatures normally found in the deep. As winter approaches, bottlenose dolphins must escape their freezing fjord, while in a mountain river, a longfin eel heeds the call of the sea.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: The south-eastern coast of New Zealand are some of the richest fishing grounds in the world - the place for young marine animals to transition from novices to independent adults. Young whales, dolphins and seals learn to hunt, learn the rules of society, or strike out on their own adventures.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: Australia is home to one of the most successful mammals on the planet: the bat. And one of the most gregarious of its kind is the flying fox. With its metre-long wingspan, the grey-headed flying fox is the largest fruit-eating bat in the country.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: Marsupials have evolved in isolation to become some of the most extraordinary creatures on the planet. While they all share similarities, some of the rare smaller species like quokkas and quolls highlight their fascinating differences.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted bull sharks deep in Cozumel's underwater reefs. Watch as these huge sharks swim and interact with the other inhabitants of these coral reefs.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: A Hawaiian volcano called Kilauea is one of the most active in the world. After years of constant lava activity, see how a sudden collapse of the crater floor and a massive eruption drains it of lava, making the volcano possible to explore.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Visit Anak Krakatoa as it enters a violent phase. Known as "The Child of Fire," this volcano is an ancestor of Krakatoa, a volcano known for the largest eruption in modern history. Will its descendant repeat the pattern?

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons
programme.desc: Nestled on Africa's southwestern tip lies a spectacular mountain range, home to an incredible diversity of life, including the elusive Cape mountain leopard. Follow a team using every trick in the book to catch a glimpse of this mysterious creature.

programme.title: Inside Saudi Arabia
programme.desc: We travel to the rarely covered conservative South, on the border with Yemen, where the population's resistance to change is the fiercest.

programme.title: Asia Alive
programme.desc: While one has a central figure, the Prambanan boasts a cast of celestial gods.

programme.title: Asia Alive
programme.desc: Asia Alive takes the viewer on a trip to Penang; and through its passionate citizens.

programme.title: UAE From Above
programme.desc: Famous for its record-breaking skyscrapers, mega hotels and vast island resorts, the United Arab Emirates has a hidden side of diverse landscapes and natural beauty.

programme.title: Inside Saudi Arabia
programme.desc: We follow the trail of the pilgrims, from the port of Jeddah to the Holy Kaba. There is a call for a more moderate Islam, but do religious leaders really support this?

programme.title: Asia Alive
programme.desc: Coron Island is one of the top scuba diving sites in the world receiving thousands of tourists.

programme.title: Asia Alive
programme.desc: Asia Alive takes the viewer to the sprawling Borobudur to understand what this UNESCO Heritage site means to those who are intimately connected to it.
